definition: to fight and scheme against each other (idiom)/(in palace construction) elaborate and refined
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
surname Gou
see 勾當|勾当[gou4 dang4]
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
variant of 鬭|斗[dou4]
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
variant of 鬥|斗[dou4]
variant of 鬥|斗[dou4]
surname Jue
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Proud nobles quarelled or plotted against each other.
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的贵族彼此勾心斗角。

sentences.english: There are many people who intrigue against each other for power and position.
sentences.chinese: 很多人因为夺权谋位而勾心斗角。

sentences.english: Jabba tasked his two competing henchmen to capture the elusive stowaway.
sentences.chinese: 贾巴命令两个勾心斗角的心腹去捉拿逃跑的偷渡者。

sentences.english: Only after twenty years' jockeying for power did he attain this position of great influence.
sentences.chinese: 勾心斗角二十年，他才爬上了这把极有权势的金交椅。

sentences.english: Intrigue against each other is quotidian in every company.
sentences.chinese: 勾心斗角在每个单位都司空见惯。

definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
variant of 勾心鬥角|勾心斗角[gou1 xin1 dou4 jiao3]
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
conflict/internal strife/dissension
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
power struggle
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
struggle/war
crafty plots and machinations (idiom)
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
trickery/tactics
to feign civility (idiom)
scheming/shrewdness
to dispute
art of politics/political tricks (often derog.)/power play/to play at politics/underhand trickery
